member.name: T:Sisus.Debugging.ChannelEnabled
member.summary: Specifies options related to log channel enabledness.

member.name: T:Sisus.Debugging.Channels
member.summary: Represents a collection of and offers a number of methods and properties to get information about the channels or modify them.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Channels.EnableChannel(System.String)
member.summary: Enables logging of messages on the given channel.
member.param: Name of the channel to enable.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Channels.EnableChannel(Sisus.Debugging.Channels.ChannelData)
member.summary: Enables logging of messages on the given .
member.param: Data for the channel to enable.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Channels.DisableChannel(System.String)
member.summary: Disables logging of messages on the given channel.
member.param: Name of the channel to disable.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Channels.DisableChannel(Sisus.Debugging.Channels.ChannelData)
member.summary: Disables logging of messages on the given .
member.param: Data for the channel to disable.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Channels.RegisterChannel(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the given to the collection and selects a color that will be used for the channel prefix in logged messages.
member.param: Name of the channel to register.

member.name: T:Sisus.Debugging.Critical
member.summary: Utility class containing Debugging methods similar to the class, with three main differences: 1. The messages use a larger font in the console window. 2. They always include stack trace even if they have been disabled for normal messages in Player Settings. 3. The messages are always recorded in builds, even if "Use Player Log" is disabled in Player Settings.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Critical.Log(System.Object,UnityEngine.Object)
member.summary:
Logs a to the console.
The message uses a larger font in the console window and always includes stack trace information. The message will also always be recorded in builds, even if "Use Player Log" is disabled in Player Settings.
member.param: to be converted to representation for display.
to which the message applies.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Critical.Ensure(System.Boolean,UnityEngine.Object)
member.param: Condition you expect to be .
to which the assertion applies.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Critical.Ensure(System.Int32,System.Boolean,UnityEngine.Object)
member.param: The channel to which the message belongs if logged.
Condition you expect to be .
to which the assertion applies.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Critical.LogCriticalToFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Logs critical message to Player.log file with CRITICAL!!! prefix and with stack trace included.

members.member:
* \nosubgrouping
Extended version of the built-in Debug class with additional methods to ease debugging while developing a game.

member.name: P:Sisus.Debugging.Debug.developerConsoleVisible
member.summary: Reports whether the development Console is visible.

member.name: P:Sisus.Debugging.Debug.isDebugBuild
member.summary:
In the Build Settings dialog there is a check box called "Development Build".
If it is checked will be . In the editor isDebugBuild always returns .
When "Strip Log Calls From Builds" is checked in Project Settings for Console, then logging done using the class will be stripped from non-development builds.
Additionally logging done using the class will always be stripped from non-development builds, regardless of whether or not "Strip Log Calls From Builds" is checked.
Logging done using the class will always be recorded even in non-development builds, regardless of whether or not "Strip Log Calls From Builds" is checked.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Debug.LogFormat(UnityEngine.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.param:
to which the message applies.
If you pass a context argument that will be momentarily highlighted in the Hierarchy window when you click the log message in the Console.

A composite format string based on which the message is generated.
Each format item inside the string is replaced by the value of the argument at the same index.
A format item consists of braces ("{" and "}") containing the index of the argument whose value should be inserted into the string at that location.
Zero or more objects to be converted to string and inserted into the composite format string.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Debug.LogFormat(System.Int32,System.String,System.Object[])

members.member:
@}
* @name Log State - Logs to the Console the name and value of every field and property of the target object @{
Logs to the Console the name and value of every field and property of matched using the specified .
With a small number of listed members a comma will be used to separate them, and with a larger number of members a line break will be used.
instance whose class members are to be listed.
used when searching for the members.
By default only public and non-inherited instance members are listed.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Debug.LogState(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Logs to the Console the name and value of every field and property of matched using the specified settings.
With a small number of listed members a comma will be used to separate them, and with a larger number of members a line break will be used.
member.param: instance whose members are to be listed.
If then only public members will be listed; otherwise, non-public members will also be listed.
If then only instance members will be listed; otherwise, static members will also be listed.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Debug.LogState(System.Type,System.Reflection.BindingFlags)
member.summary:
Logs to the Console the name and value of every static field and property of matched using the specified .
With a small number of listed members a comma will be used to separate them, and with a larger number of members a line break will be used.
member.param: of the class whose members are to be listed.

used when searching for the members.
By default only public and non-inherited static members are listed.

members.member:
@}
* @name Log To File - Logs a message to a file @{
Appends a message to the end of the log file.
Note that calls to this method will function even in release builds with build stripping enabled. As such it is possible to use this method to log some critical messages manually even if otherwise all logging has been disabled across the project.
Message to add to the log file. Path to the log file to which the message should be added.
: The log file is cleared before the is written to it if this is the first time during this session that is called for this file path.
: The log file is cleared now before the message is written to it.
This might be an useful if you have a log file dedicated to holding only one type of information like system information or performance metrics, and you want to write all the information at once to the log file, replacing its old contents entirely with each call.
: This method call will never clear the log file.
Note that with this option the log file will continue growing larger with each call of this method until it is manually cleared by calling .

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Debug.ClearLogFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes existing log file at the given path created by a call if one exists.
member.param: Path to the log file.
If a backup is created of the log file before it is deleted, if one is found.

members.member:
@}
* @name Log Changes - Logs to the Console the name and value of a class member any time its value is changed @{
Logs to the Console the name and value of any time its value is changed.
This will continue happening until is called with an expression pointing to the same class member.
At runtime logging takes place at the end of each frame.
Expression pointing to the class member to track. If then the editor will be paused whenever the value of the class member changes; otherwise, editor will not be paused.
In builds this parameter will have no effect; the application will not be paused regardless of its value.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Debug.LogChanges(System.Object,System.Reflection.MemberInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Logs to the Console the name and value of any time its value is changed.
This will continue happening until is called with an expression pointing to the same class member.
At runtime logging takes place at the end of each frame.
member.param:
Instance of the class that contains the member and from which the value of the member is read.
This can be if the represents a static member.
representing the class member to track.

If then the editor will be paused whenever the value of the class member changes; otherwise, editor will not be paused.
In builds this parameter will have no effect; the application will not be paused regardless of its value.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Debug.CancelLogChanges(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{System.Object}})
member.summary: Stop logging to the Console any time the value of changes.
member.param: Expression pointing to a class member that is being tracked.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Debug.CancelLogChanges(System.Reflection.MemberInfo)
member.summary: Stop logging to the Console any time the value of changes.
member.param: Expression pointing to a class member that is being tracked.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Dev.LogFormat``1(UnityEngine.LogType,``0,UnityEngine.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Logs a message to the Console formed by inserting the values of zero or more objects into a text string.
Calls to this method will be fully stripped from release builds.
member.param: Type of the message; Log, Warning, Error, Assert or Exception.
Option flags for specifying special treatment of a log message.

to which the message applies.
If you pass a context argument that will be momentarily highlighted in the Hierarchy window when you click the log message in the Console.

A composite format string based on which the message is generated.
Each format item inside the string is replaced by the value of the argument at the same index.
A format item consists of braces ("{" and "}") containing the index of the argument whose value should be inserted into the string at that location.
Zero or more objects to be converted to string and inserted into the composite format string.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Dev.LogState(System.Object,System.Reflection.BindingFlags)
member.summary:
Logs to the Console the name and value of every field and property of matched using the specified .
With a small number of listed members a comma will be used to separate them, and with a larger number of members a line break will be used.
Calls to this method will be fully stripped from release builds.
member.param: instance whose class members are to be listed.

used when searching for the members.
By default only public and non-inherited instance members are listed.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Dev.LogState(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Logs to the Console the name and value of every field and property of matched using the specified settings.
With a small number of listed members a comma will be used to separate them, and with a larger number of members a line break will be used.
Calls to this method will be fully stripped from release builds.
member.param: instance whose members are to be listed.
If then only public members will be listed; otherwise, non-public members will also be listed.
If then only instance members will be listed; otherwise, static members will also be listed.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Dev.LogState(System.Type,System.Reflection.BindingFlags)
member.summary:
Logs to the Console the name and value of every static field and property of matched using the specified .
With a small number of listed members a comma will be used to separate them, and with a larger number of members a line break will be used.
Calls to this method will be fully stripped from release builds.
member.param: of the class whose members are to be listed.

used when searching for the members.
By default only public and non-inherited static members are listed.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Dev.LogChanges(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{System.Object}},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Logs to the Console the name and value of any time its value is changed.
This will continue happening until is called with an expression pointing to the same class member.
At runtime logging takes place at the end of each frame.
Calls to this method will be fully stripped from release builds.
member.param: Expression pointing to the class member to track.

If then the editor will be paused whenever the value of the class member changes; otherwise, editor will not be paused.
In builds this parameter will have no effect; the application will not be paused regardless of its value.

Calls to this method will be fully stripped from release builds.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Dev.StartStopwatch(System.String)
member.param: The name for the stopwatch.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Dev.StartSubStopwatch(System.String)
member.param: The label for the timer.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Dev.StartSubStopwatch(System.String,System.String)
member.param: Name of parent stopwatch under which the sub-stopwatch will be nested.
Name of new sub-stopwatch to start.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Dev.FinishSubStopwatch
member.summary:
Gets the last started stopwatch and finishes the sub-stopwatch inside it which was last started, still leaving the main stopwatch running.
Results are not logged at this point, only when you finish the main stopwatch.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.Dev.FinishSubStopwatch(System.String)
member.summary: Finishes a previously created sub-stopwatch, still leaving the main stopwatch running. Results are not logged at this point, only when you finish the main stopwatch.
member.param: Name of main stopwatch.

members.member: Logs results of a previously created stopwatch and then clears it.
Logs results of a previously created stopwatch and then clears it.
Logs results of a all previously created stopwatches and the clears them.

member.name: T:Sisus.Debugging.DevCritical
member.summary: Utility class containing Debugging methods similar to the class, with four main differences: 1. The messages use a larger font in the console window. 2. They always include stack trace even if they have been disabled for normal messages in Player Settings. 3. All calls to its methods including any calls made in their arguments are completely omitted in release builds.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.DevCritical.LogCriticalToFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Logs critical message to Player.log file with CRITICAL!!! prefix and with stack trace included.

member.name: F:Sisus.Debugging.RuntimeDebugger.onGUIOpened
member.summary: Called whenever the GUI is opened due to user input.

member.name: F:Sisus.Debugging.RuntimeDebugger.onGUIClosed
member.summary: Called whenever the GUI is closed due to user input.

member.name: P:Sisus.Debugging.RuntimeDebugger.Enabled
member.summary: Returns value determining whether or not RuntimeDebugger is currently active.

member.name: M:Sisus.Debugging.ValueTracker.Update
member.summary:
This should be called during every Update, LateUpdate or a comparable event function.
Logs a message to the console if the value tracked member has changed since last update.
